alert.note: Alert for Logan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following county, Logan. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 258 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches could fall over the area from the heavy storms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Russellville, Auburn, Cave Springs, Danby, Whippoorwill, Epleys, Gordonsville, Cooperstown, Crossroad and Old Volney. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
